main_definition: Prior refers to something that comes before in time, order, or importance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a previous event, situation, or condition.
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee reviewed the prior case and found similarities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A legal term referring to an agreement that has been executed but not yet ratified as a binding contract.
meanings_and_examples.example: Party A issued a prior, which Party B agreed to under certain conditions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Prioritizing something over other things in order of importance or urgency.
meanings_and_examples.example: The project manager had to prioritize tasks based on their deadlines and criticality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A church building or complex, especially one that is no longer used regularly for worship services.
meanings_and_examples.example: Our group visited the local priory during our trip to explore historical architecture.
